build_failure_reason: OWLAPI 5.1.20 requires extensive transitive dependencies (RDF4j, hppcrt, Caffeine, javax.inject, commons-rdf-api, etc.) that are not bundled in the distribution JAR. Manual dependency resolution proved complex and error-prone without a build tool like Maven/Gradle.
elk_owl2_el_limitations: OWL 2 EL does NOT support negation (owl:complementOf)
OWL 2 EL does NOT support disjunction (owl:unionOf as superclass)
OWL 2 EL does NOT support universal restrictions (owl:allValuesFrom)
OWL 2 EL does NOT support cardinality restrictions (owl:maxCardinality, owl:minCardinality)
OWL 2 EL does NOT support nominals/oneOf (owl:oneOf)
OWL 2 EL does NOT support property chains beyond simple transitivity
OWL 2 EL does NOT support inverse properties (owl:inverseOf)

safety_axioms_not_expressible.description: The following safety axioms from the KIF ontology CANNOT be expressed in OWL 2 EL and therefore CANNOT be reasoned over by ELK.

axioms.limitation: Requires numeric comparison (lessThan) and conditional logic - not expressible in OWL 2 EL
Requires deontic logic (should) and conditional implications - not expressible in OWL
Requires modal logic (mustExecute) - not expressible in OWL
Requires temporal reasoning (during) - not expressible in OWL 2 EL
Requires spatial reasoning about geofence boundaries - not expressible in OWL 2 EL

comparison_to_prolog.summary: Unlike ELK/OWL, Prolog CAN express all safety axioms from the KIF ontology
prolog_advantages: Full first-order logic with variables and quantifiers
Efficient pattern matching for real-time safety monitoring
comparison_to_prolog.recommendation: For UAV safety-critical reasoning requiring numeric thresholds and conditional rules, use Prolog rather than OWL 2 EL reasoners

what_elk_could_do_if_working.class_hierarchy_queries: Get all subclasses of UAV, Sensor, Mission, etc.
what_elk_could_do_if_working.subsumption_checking: Verify FlybyF11 subClassOf Quadcopter subClassOf Multirotor subClassOf UAV
what_elk_could_do_if_working.instance_retrieval: Find all instances of FlightPhase, MissionStatus, etc.
what_elk_could_do_if_working.unsatisfiable_class_detection: Find classes that cannot have instances

notes: ELK is designed for large-scale biomedical ontologies like SNOMED-CT with millions of classes
Polynomial-time classification makes ELK extremely fast for what it CAN express
The UAV domain ontology is small enough that classification would be sub-millisecond
For drone autonomy with safety constraints, the expressivity limitations are the blocker, not performance
